conclusion: Objects A and B start moving from the same location in the same direction.
The velocity-time graph for Object A is a straight line, and for Object B, it is a curved line.
The slope of the velocity-time graph for Object A at \\( t_1 \\) is constant and represents its acceleration.
The slope of the velocity-time graph for Object B at \\( t_1 \\) is determined by the tangent to the curve at that point.
The slope of the tangent to Object B's curve at \\( t_1 \\) is steeper than the slope of Object A's line at \\( t_1 \\).
Therefore, the acceleration of Object A at \\( t_1 \\) is not the same as the acceleration of Object B at \\( t_1 \\).
